{{Tutorial
|title    = About the Multi-Layered Map
|subtitle = Important Message
|type     = System
|icon     = Icon Tutorial Important.png
|about    = Map
|image1   = Tutorial About the Multi-Layered Map 1.png
|text1    = You will sometimes encounter [[Teleport Waypoint]] and [[Domain]] Entrance Map Pins bearing such sub-icons.<br>These symbols indicate that the destination is located in a multi-layered area. After you unlock the corresponding map layer, you can interact with said pins to open the corresponding sub-map.
|image2   = Tutorial About the Multi-Layered Map 2.png
|text2    = Use the layer markers on the right of the Map interface to switch between layers within the same group or select the big icon to return to the top-level map.
|image3   = Tutorial About the Multi-Layered Map 3.png
|text3    = When browsing map layers, the sub-icon of the Map Pin(s) for the current layer will appear in bright blue.
|image4   = Tutorial About the Multi-Layered Map 4.png
|text4    = Dotted lines will be used for indicators ([[Quest]] targets, [[Event]] targets, etc.) that are not located in the current map layer.
|image5   = Tutorial About the Multi-Layered Map 5.png
|text5    = Additionally, when an area in the center of the map contains different layers that you have previously entered, you can use the layer-switching marker to swap over to the corresponding map.
|sort     = 4021
}}
